title: What are some of the best verses in hip-hop history? - Quora

response.answer_text: Alright. Here are some great verses. Meat Grinder: Madvillain. The song is just one really long ridiculous tongue twisting 2 minute verse that packs a ferocious punch. Great track. DOOM’s style is downright vicious, and Madlib’s beats are perfect. Nicki Minaj’s verse on Monster: Kanye ft Rick Ross, Jay Z, Nicki Minaj, Bon Iver. The song has some ridiculous verses from Kanye, Rick Ross, and Jay Z. This pales in comparison, however, to the complete maniacal ripping to shreds of the lines Nicki Minaj (of all people) drops. Nicki Minaj’s verse is considered one of THE best verses on a hip hop track, EVER. That’s saying something. The first verse on m.A.A.d city: Kendrick Lamar. Kendrick Lamar gives his best verse ever on this MC Eiht featuring title track from his breakout album, Good Kid m.A.A.d City. It’s angry, vicious, almost unrelenting in it’s grim storytelling. It’s a dark tale about his life in Compton, and delivery is near perfect. Q-Tip’s verse on Scenario: A Tribe Called Quest ft Native Tongues. Tip’s verse is short, but it’s an incredibly smooth delivery with clever wordplay and cheeky attitude, it’s one of the smoothest verses ever. Not just that, it’s actually just a set up verse for Busta Rhymes of Native Tongues, but it steals the show. That’s just 4, but if you look on Complex | Making Culture Pop and search up best verses, you’ll find some stuff.

No order, and just throwing a few out there that would make my top 10. Nas on "Verbal Intercourse" Nas' first verse on "NY State of Mind" Inspectah Deck on "Triumph" Eminem's first verse on "Renegade" Jay-Z's "Grammy Family Freestyle" 2pac's first verse on "Ambitionz Az A Ridah" Kendrick Lamar on "Control"
